assessment.name: nng-2010-5
assessment.query: select stu.studentid as sid, c.childfname || ' ' || c.childmname || ' ' || c.childlname as cname, r.fname || ' ' || r.mname || ' ' || r.lname as pname, decode(r.relationtypeid, 1, 'father', 2, 'mother') as ptype, c.gender as csex, sg.studgroupname as class, s.id as scode, trim(s.schoolname) as sname, trim(b2.name) as b2, trim(b1.name) as b1, trim(b.name) as b from eg_school s, egems_studentgroup sg, egems_studgroup_mstr sgm, egems_schstu_association scg, eg_section sec, egems_student stu, egclts_child c, egclts_childrelation cr, egclts_relation r, eg_boundary b, eg_boundary b1, eg_boundary b2, eg_boundary_type bt where s.id_adm_boundary = b.ID_BNDRY and b.PARENT = b1.ID_BNDRY and b1.PARENT = b2.ID_BNDRY and b.id_bndry_type = bt.id_bndry_type and bt.id_heirarchy_type = 1 and sg.schoolid = s.id and sg.STUDENTGROUPID = scg.STUDENTGROUPID and sg.groupid = sgm.groupid and sgm.groupname = 'Class' and sg.studgroupname = '5' and sg.sectionid = sec.sectionid and scg.STUDENTID = stu.studentid and stu.is_active = 1 and stu.statusid = 1 and scg.academicyearid = 101 and stu.childid = c.childid and c.childid = cr.childid and cr.childrelationid = r.relationid and r.relationtypeid in (1, 2) --and b1.id_bndry in (8880, 8881, 8885) and s.id = 32498
